timeline.message:
Make Computer#getLogDir thread-safe

When called by concurrent threads, the call to IOUtils.mkdirs could
fail with FileAlreadyExistException

timeline.body:
```suggestion
    private final Object logDirLock = new String("logDirLock);
```

since a future version of Java may not support synchronizing on `Object`
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
private final Object logDirLock = new Object();
private final Object logDirLock = new String("logDirLock);

since a future version of Java may not support synchronizing on Object
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.body: Out of curiosity: why not just a `synchronized` method? The time saved is superfluous and it is cleaner. WDYT?
timeline.bodyText: Out of curiosity: why not just a synchronized method? The time saved is superfluous and it is cleaner. WDYT?

timeline.author: MRamonLeon

replies.bodyText: To avoid reusing the Computer monitor which might already be used for other purposes, and possibly introducing deadlocks or contention.
